Description: Rim fragment of East Greek pottery black-figured plate; interior slipped. On top of rim, leftward maeander; broad band at join of rim and floor join with added red band lined in white; in frieze on floor, sphinx to left (the upper part preserved); added red on the head and wing-feathers of the sphinx. On unslipped(?) underside, black band on the rim, a red one on the floor.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 21, no. 69, pl. 19)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (pl. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.698)
